title: Three new tools to try in Google Meet.
description: Our latest Workspace drop is here and includes some helpful Gemini updates for Google Meet business users. Here are few new things to try:The “Take notes for me” feature…
excerpt: Our latest Workspace drop is here and includes some helpful Gemini updates for Google Meet business users. Here are few new things to try:The “Take notes for me” feature can capture follow-up action items from meetings with a new “Suggested next steps” section in your meeting notes.When you turn on the transcript for the meeting, the meeting notes that Gemini creates will link to the relevant part of the transcript so you can see more details and verbatim quotes.If you missed part of the conversation or need to refresh your memory, you can now scroll through the meeting captions while the meeting is happening.To see what else is new, be sure to check out the Workspace blog for the full feature drop.
text: Our latest Workspace drop is here and includes some helpful Gemini updates for Google Meet business users. Here are few new things to try:The “Take notes for me” feature can capture follow-up action items from meetings with a new “Suggested next steps” section in your meeting notes.When you turn on the transcript for the meeting, the meeting notes that Gemini creates will link to the relevant part of the transcript so you can see more details and verbatim quotes.If you missed part of the conversation or need to refresh your memory, you can now scroll through the meeting captions while the meeting is happening.To see what else is new, be sure to check out the Workspace blog for the full feature drop.
html:
Our latest Workspace drop is here and includes some helpful Gemini updates for Google Meet business users. Here are few new things to try:

  1. The “Take notes for me” feature can capture follow-up action items from meetings with a new “Suggested next steps” section in your meeting notes.
  2. When you turn on the transcript for the meeting, the meeting notes that Gemini creates will link to the relevant part of the transcript so you can see more details and verbatim quotes.
  3. If you missed part of the conversation or need to refresh your memory, you can now scroll through the meeting captions while the meeting is happening.

To see what else is new, be sure to check out the Workspace blog for the full feature drop.
